Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/dnsblog/dnsblog.c

1/* $NetBSD: dnsblog.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:45 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* dnsblog 8
6/* SUMMARY
7/* Postfix DNS white/blacklist logger
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* \fBdnsblog\fR [generic Postfix daemon options]
10/* DESCRIPTION
11/* The \fBdnsblog\fR(8) server implements an ad-hoc DNS
12/* white/blacklist lookup service. This may eventually be
13/* replaced by an UDP client that is built directly into the
14/* \fBpostscreen\fR(8) server.
15/* PROTOCOL
16/* .ad
17/* .fi
18/* With each connection, the \fBdnsblog\fR(8) server receives
19/* a DNS white/blacklist domain name, an IP address, and an ID.
20/* If the IP address is listed under the DNS white/blacklist, the
21/* \fBdnsblog\fR(8) server logs the match and replies with the
22/* query arguments plus an address list with the resulting IP
23/* addresses, separated by whitespace, and the reply TTL.
24/* Otherwise it replies with the query arguments plus an empty
25/* address list and the reply TTL (-1 if unavailable). Finally,
26/* The \fBdnsblog\fR(8) server closes the connection.
27/* DIAGNOSTICS
28/* Problems and transactions are logged to \fBsyslogd\fR(8).
29/* CONFIGURATION PARAMETERS
30/* .ad
31/* .fi
32/* Changes to \fBmain.cf\fR are picked up automatically, as
33/* \fBdnsblog\fR(8) processes run for only a limited amount
34/* of time. Use the command "\fBpostfix reload\fR" to speed
35/* up a change.
36/*
37/* The text below provides only a parameter summary. See
38/* \fBpostconf\fR(5) for more details including examples.
39/* .IP "\fBconfig_directory (see 'postconf -d' output)\fR"
40/* The default location of the Postfix main.cf and master.cf
41/* configuration files.
42/* .IP "\fBdaemon_timeout (18000s)\fR"
43/* How much time a Postfix daemon process may take to handle a
44/* request before it is terminated by a built-in watchdog timer.
45/* .IP "\fBpostscreen_dnsbl_sites (empty)\fR"
46/* Optional list of DNS white/blacklist domains, filters and weight
47/* factors.
48/* .IP "\fBipc_timeout (3600s)\fR"
49/* The time limit for sending or receiving information over an internal
50/* communication channel.
51/* .IP "\fBprocess_id (read-only)\fR"
52/* The process ID of a Postfix command or daemon process.
53/* .IP "\fBprocess_name (read-only)\fR"
54/* The process name of a Postfix command or daemon process.
55/* .IP "\fBqueue_directory (see 'postconf -d' output)\fR"
56/* The location of the Postfix top-level queue directory.
57/* .IP "\fBsyslog_facility (mail)\fR"
58/* The syslog facility of Postfix logging.
59/* .IP "\fBsyslog_name (see 'postconf -d' output)\fR"
60/* The mail system name that is prepended to the process name in syslog
61/* records, so that "smtpd" becomes, for example, "postfix/smtpd".
62/* SEE ALSO
63/* smtpd(8), Postfix SMTP server
64/* postconf(5), configuration parameters
65/* syslogd(5), system logging
66/* LICENSE
67/* .ad
68/* .fi
69/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
70/* HISTORY
71/* .ad
72/* .fi
73/* This service was introduced with Postfix version 2.8.
74/* AUTHOR(S)
75/* Wietse Venema
76/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
77/* P.O. Box 704
78/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
79/*
80/* Wietse Venema
81/* Google, Inc.
82/* 111 8th Avenue
83/* New York, NY 10011, USA
84/*--*/
85
86/* System library. */
87
88#include <sys_defs.h>
89#include <limits.h>
90
91/* Utility library. */
92
93#include <msg.h>
94#include <vstream.h>
95#include <vstring.h>
96#include <argv.h>
97#include <myaddrinfo.h>
98#include <valid_hostname.h>
99#include <sock_addr.h>
100
101/* Global library. */
102
103#include <mail_conf.h>
104#include <mail_version.h>
105#include <mail_proto.h>
106#include <mail_params.h>
107
108/* DNS library. */
109
110#include <dns.h>
111
112/* Server skeleton. */
113
114#include <mail_server.h>
115
116/* Application-specific. */
117
118 /*
119 * Tunable parameters.
120 */
121int var_dnsblog_delay;
122
123 /*
124 * Static so we don't allocate and free on every request.
125 */
126static VSTRING *rbl_domain;
127static VSTRING *addr;
128static VSTRING *query;
129static VSTRING *why;
130static VSTRING *result;
131
132 /*
133 * Silly little macros.
134 */
135#define STR(x) vstring_str(x)
136#define LEN(x) VSTRING_LEN(x)
137
138/* static void dnsblog_query - query DNSBL for client address */
139
140static VSTRING *dnsblog_query(VSTRING *result, int *result_ttl,
141 const char *dnsbl_domain,
142 const char *addr)
143{
144 const char *myname = "dnsblog_query";
145 ARGV *octets;
146 int i;
147 struct addrinfo *res;
148 unsigned char *ipv6_addr;
149 int dns_status;
150 DNS_RR *addr_list;
151 DNS_RR *rr;
152 MAI_HOSTADDR_STR hostaddr;
153
154 if (msg_verbose)
155 msg_info("%s: addr %s dnsbl_domain %s",
156 myname, addr, dnsbl_domain);
157
158 VSTRING_RESET(query);
159
160 /*
161 * Reverse the client IPV6 address, represented as 32 hexadecimal
162 * nibbles. We use the binary address to avoid tricky code. Asking for an
163 * AAAA record makes no sense here. Just like with IPv4 we use the lookup
164 * result as a bit mask, not as an IP address.
165 */
166#ifdef HAS_IPV6
167 if (valid_ipv6_hostaddr(addr, DONT_GRIPE)) {
168 if (hostaddr_to_sockaddr(addr, (char *) 0, 0, &res) != 0
169 || res->ai_family != PF_INET6)
170 msg_fatal("%s: unable to convert address %s", myname, addr);
171 ipv6_addr = (unsigned char *) &SOCK_ADDR_IN6_ADDR(res->ai_addr);
172 for (i = sizeof(SOCK_ADDR_IN6_ADDR(res->ai_addr)) - 1; i >= 0; i--)
173 vstring_sprintf_append(query, "%x.%x.",
174 ipv6_addr[i] & 0xf, ipv6_addr[i] >> 4);
175 freeaddrinfo(res);
176 } else
177#endif
178
179 /*
180 * Reverse the client IPV4 address, represented as four decimal octet
181 * values. We use the textual address for convenience.
182 */
183 {
184 octets = argv_split(addr, ".");
185 for (i = octets->argc - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
186 vstring_strcat(query, octets->argv[i]);
187 vstring_strcat(query, ".");
188 }
189 argv_free(octets);
190 }
191
192 /*
193 * Tack on the RBL domain name and query the DNS for an A record.
194 */
195 vstring_strcat(query, dnsbl_domain);
196 dns_status = dns_lookup_x(STR(query), T_A, 0, &addr_list, (VSTRING *) 0,
197 why, (int *) 0, DNS_REQ_FLAG_NCACHE_TTL);
198
199 /*
200 * We return the lowest TTL in the response from the A record(s) if
201 * found, or from the SOA record(s) if available. If the reply specifies
202 * no TTL, or if the query fails, we return a TTL of -1.
203 */
204 VSTRING_RESET(result);
205 *result_ttl = -1;
206 if (dns_status == DNS_OK) {
207 for (rr = addr_list; rr != 0; rr = rr->next) {
208 if (dns_rr_to_pa(rr, &hostaddr) == 0) {
209 msg_warn("%s: skipping reply record type %s for query %s: %m",
210 myname, dns_strtype(rr->type), STR(query));
211 } else {
212 msg_info("addr %s listed by domain %s as %s",
213 addr, dnsbl_domain, hostaddr.buf);
214 if (LEN(result) > 0)
215 vstring_strcat(result, " ");
216 vstring_strcat(result, hostaddr.buf);
217 /* Grab the positive reply TTL. */
218 if (*result_ttl < 0 || *result_ttl > rr->ttl)
219 *result_ttl = rr->ttl;
220 }
221 }
222 dns_rr_free(addr_list);
223 } else if (dns_status == DNS_NOTFOUND) {
224 if (msg_verbose)
225 msg_info("%s: addr %s not listed by domain %s",
226 myname, addr, dnsbl_domain);
227 /* Grab the negative reply TTL. */
228 for (rr = addr_list; rr != 0; rr = rr->next) {
229 if (rr->type == T_SOA && (*result_ttl < 0 || *result_ttl > rr->ttl))
230 *result_ttl = rr->ttl;
231 }
232 dns_rr_free(addr_list);
233 } else {
234 msg_warn("%s: lookup error for DNS query %s: %s",
235 myname, STR(query), STR(why));
236 }
237 VSTRING_TERMINATE(result);
238 return (result);
239}
240
241/* dnsblog_service - perform service for client */
242
243static void dnsblog_service(VSTREAM *client_stream, char *unused_service,
244 char **argv)
245{
246 int request_id;
247 int result_ttl;
248
249 /*
250 * Sanity check. This service takes no command-line arguments.
251 */
252 if (argv[0])
253 msg_fatal("unexpected command-line argument: %s", argv[0]);
254
255 /*
256 * This routine runs whenever a client connects to the socket dedicated
257 * to the dnsblog service. All connection-management stuff is handled by
258 * the common code in single_server.c.
259 */
260 if (attr_scan(client_stream,
261 ATTR_FLAG_MORE | ATTR_FLAG_STRICT,
262 RECV_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_RBL_DOMAIN, rbl_domain),
263 RECV_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_ACT_CLIENT_ADDR, addr),
264 RECV_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_LABEL, &request_id),
265 ATTR_TYPE_END) == 3) {
266 (void) dnsblog_query(result, &result_ttl, STR(rbl_domain), STR(addr));
267 if (var_dnsblog_delay > 0)
268 sleep(var_dnsblog_delay);
269 attr_print(client_stream, ATTR_FLAG_NONE,
270 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_RBL_DOMAIN, STR(rbl_domain)),
271 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_ACT_CLIENT_ADDR, STR(addr)),
272 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_LABEL, request_id),
273 SEND_ATTR_STR(MAIL_ATTR_RBL_ADDR, STR(result)),
274 SEND_ATTR_INT(MAIL_ATTR_TTL, result_ttl),
275 ATTR_TYPE_END);
276 vstream_fflush(client_stream);
277 }
278}
279
280/* post_jail_init - post-jail initialization */
281
282static void post_jail_init(char *unused_name, char **unused_argv)
283{
284 rbl_domain = vstring_alloc(100);
285 addr = vstring_alloc(100);
286 query = vstring_alloc(100);
287 why = vstring_alloc(100);
288 result = vstring_alloc(100);
289 var_use_limit = 0;
290}
291
292MAIL_VERSION_STAMP_DECLARE;
293
294/* main - pass control to the multi-threaded skeleton */
295
296int main(int argc, char **argv)
297{
298 static const CONFIG_TIME_TABLE time_table[] = {
299 VAR_DNSBLOG_DELAY, DEF_DNSBLOG_DELAY, &var_dnsblog_delay, 0, 0,
300 0,
301 };
302
303 /*
304 * Fingerprint executables and core dumps.
305 */
306 MAIL_VERSION_STAMP_ALLOCATE;
307
308 single_server_main(argc, argv, dnsblog_service,
309 CA_MAIL_SERVER_TIME_TABLE(time_table),
310 CA_MAIL_SERVER_POST_INIT(post_jail_init),
311 CA_MAIL_SERVER_UNLIMITED,
312 0);
313}
